intro: Galium × lindbergii, commonly known as Lindberg's bedstraw, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Galium × lindbergii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species in the genus Galium.
